findings.title: ST - Stops Transactions
findings.description: The transactions are initially disabled for all users excluding the owner address and the liquidity address. The owner can enable the transactions for all users. Once the transactions are enabled, the owner will not be able to disable them again.

findings.title: CSD - Circulating Supply Discrepancy
findings.description: The contract does not return the totalSupply(). Instead, the function returns the totalSupply() minus the amount that has been moved to the dead address. This amount is the circulating supply of the token.

findings.title: RSW - Redundant Storage Writes
findings.description: The contract updates the `_noFee` mapping even if its current state is the same as the one passed as an argument, resulting in redundant storage writes.

findings.title: TPP - Token Pair Prevalidation
findings.description: The variable `newPair` can be any address and the contract does not validate if a token pair exists between four addresses, leading to unintended behavior and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: RE - Redundant Events
findings.description: The `_changeThreshold`, `_changeFees`, and `SwapAndLiquify` events are not utilized in the contract's implementation and hence are redundant.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract is using variables that initialize them only in the constructor and are not mutated by other functions, but these variables are not defined as `immutable`. Declaring a variable as immutable can reduce storage and computation required by the contract, making it more gas-efficient.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity style guide, which can lead to decreased readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.
